intro: Fibichia dactylon, commonly known as the goatweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Fibichia dactylon is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
